snippet: In New York, after the killing of an unarmed man during an arrest, city leaders showed that they are learning from the mistakes of the past.
abstract: Lawrence Downes Editorial Observer notes former New York City Mayor Rudolph Giuliani has criticized Mayor Bill de Blasio's handling of death of Eric Garner at hands of police in Staten Island; asserts that while de Blasio has made several missteps in office, his handling of Garner case is not among them; says de Blasio and Police Commissioner William J Bratton are right to recognize that public fears about police brutality are legitimate and to address those concerns.
lead_paragraph: In New York, after the killing of an unarmed man during an arrest, city leaders showed that they are learning from the mistakes of the past.
